intro: Passerina eriocephala, commonly known as the woolly pasqueflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, showy yellow or orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has a short, hairy stem and produces a cluster of fluffy, white to grayish seeds at the top of its stem. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and sensitive species.
